title: Casio ctx-700 VS Yamaha psr-e363 piano sounds. Looking for opinion. Which one sounds better overall in piano ONLY? - Quora

response.answer_text: I would err on the side of Yamaha, simply because they’ve been sampling their concert grands For use in their keyboards, for years. Or maybe you don’t want the over metallic sound that Yamaha have become known for. It also depends on what you’re amplifying with. Yamaha have been doing what they’ve been doing for a long time, when Casio were making watches and calculators .. does that make them better, or use a little hacknied ?
response.upvotes: Answer requested by A Girly Thing

response.answer_text: There at different price points the keys of the ctx700 are better but the Yamaha piano sample is better as you would expect from a manufacturer of real pianos

IMHO Yamaha makes musical instruments along with other products. If you have a problem with a Yamaha instrument you can find a technician to work on it. Parts are available. Casio not so much. If it breaks - good luck. Again, IMHO.
response.upvotes: Answer requested by A Girly Thing
